Erikson’s Stages of Psychosocial Development

Download Flashcards for Anki

Summary

Stage Period Years Syntactic Dystonic Virtue Maldevelopment Example
One Infancy 0–1.5 Trust Mistrust Hope Withdrawal secure environment provided by the caregiver, with regular access to affection and food
Two Early Childhood 2–3 Autonomy Shame Will Compulsion caregiver promotes self-sufficiency while maintaining a secure environment
Three Play Age 3–5 Initiative Guilt Purpose Inhibition caregiver encourages, supports, and guides the child’s own initiatives and interests
Four School Age 6–11 Industry Inferiority Competence Inertia (Passivity) reasonable expectations set in school and at home, with praise for their accomplishments
Five Adolescence 12–18 Ego Identity Confusion/Diffusion Fidelity Repudiation individual weighs out their previous experiences, societal expectations, and their aspirations in establishing values and “finding themselves”
Six Young Adulthood 19–40 Intimacy Isolation Love Distantiation individual forms close friendships or long-term partnership
Seven Adulthood 40–65 Generativity Stagnation/Self-Absorption Care Rejectivity engagement with the next generation through parenting, coaching, or teaching
Eight Old Age 65–death Integrity Despair Wisdom Disdain contemplation and acknowledgment of personal life accomplishments

References

  • Erikson, E. H. Childhood and Society (W. W. Norton Company, 1993)

  • Orenstein, G. A. et al. Eriksons Stages of Psychosocial Development StatPearls (2022)

  • Long, R. Family Unsplash (2018)
